Function.Description: The + Function returns the sum of its arguments.

Brief.Overview: The + function returns the sum of its arguments. If no arguments are specified, + returns zero.
Brief.Overview-Complex: The + function adds a variety of numeric data types to a complex number.
Brief.Usage: The + function is used whenever it is necessary to compute the sum of a set of Numbers.
Brief.Usage-Complex: The + function is used to sum numeric data types where at least one of the addends is complex. Will also handle immediate types. Since complex numbers are heap objects, they require more space. Operations on these types are slower than on immediate types.

Syntax.Return: Computes the sum of all the Numbers in the argument list. If the argument list is empty, the + function returns 0.

Syntax-Complex.Return: A complex number holding the sum of N1, N2, N3, etc.
